Posts.Content: I can relate to the little Gremlin guy. The hot flashes can be controlled however. Ask your doctor to try Megace. My doctor prescribed it for me and it worked wonders, no more hot flashes at all. Don't know if it will work for you but it was great for me. As far as the memory loss, I can't remember, it only gets worse. I learned to write everything down and had sticky notes everywhere. I was an auto mechanic all my life but found myself forgetting even simple things when when working on my cars and motorcycles. Gets very frustrating but I have somewhat learned to live with it.
Posts.Title: HT Gremlins

Posts.Content: I can relate to the little Gremlin guy. The hot flashes can be controlled however. Ask your doctor to try Megace. My doctor prescribed it for me and it worked wonders, no more hot flashes at all. Don't know if it will work for you but it was great for me. As far as the memory loss, I can't remember, it only gets worse. I learned to write everything down and had sticky notes everywhere. I was an auto mechanic all my life but found myself forgetting even simple things when when working on my cars and motorcycles. Gets very frustrating but I have somewhat learned to live with it.
Posts.Title: HT Gremlins

Posts.Content: I was on it for a year and came off last October. Some of the side effects do not go away but some do get better. I now have my body hair back, my sex drive is about 1/2 back, ability is about the same. It caused a problem with my right eye that is permanent, also I have rotting teeth from it. They say some of the side effects are permanent and more so the longer you are on it. Unfortunately my cancer has returned and my psa is back up to 7.3. I have declined surgery due to my active life style and the possible side effects. The doc is referring me to the Oncologist now so we can decide what the course of action will be to try and control the spread of cancer. I am hoping for another type of medicine that has a few less side effects but if I must go back on the Lupron I am insisting on the intermittent therapy this time instead of the constant shots every 4 months. From what I have researched it is better because the side effects are less and they have found it to be more effective to go off the Lupron until the psa rises again and then go back on it. I guess the body builds up less of a resistance to it that way. Oh the joys of this disease. I still after a year off the Lupron forget even the most simple things too. I pick up the Ipad and forget what I was going to look up, go into a room only to forget why I am there and the worst is after 40 years of being a gearhead, I forget what engine is in my car and what model it is when I go to by a part for it. I have learned just to say, my cancer has eaten all my brain cells, so I do not know. The bright side is you can watch the same movies over and over because you don't remember them! My wife says I shouldn't joke about the cancer and dying but I tell her I can joke or I can cry so I think it is better to look at it and laugh while I still can.

Posts.Title: HT Gremlins

Posts.Content: Happy Thanksgiving to all.
Posts.Title: Happy thanksgiving!

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by timbergirl Hi Rlyons, My boyfriend is currently on Lupron and hates it. He is finishing up chemo in a month and was thinking about going off Lupron at the same time. My question is what is considered intermittent Lupron treatments? How long and how much. Thank you very much and best of luck to you. His PSA is 45 and only has two more chemo treatments left. All cases are a bit different but in my case the intermittent will be 6 months on and then of my PSA has dropped back to undetectable then I will stop the injections until my PSA starts to climb (if it does) then I will start the injections again until a time when the PSA climbs again. The studies and my doc have said that way the body will not adjust to the lupron as quickly allowing it to work longer as well as lessor side effects than to have the injections for a long period of time.
Posts.Title: Thinking about quitting HT. Has anyone else?

Posts.Content: Also do not assume your time is limited, the doctors are not god and can't predict the time you have left. Also new meds and treatments are evolving every day. My Urologist told me I could expect 2 to 5 years and the Oncologist said that was ridiculous, he saw no reason that I shouldn't have a lot of years left.
Posts.Title: Thinking about quitting HT. Has anyone else?

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by timbergirl Hi Rlyons, My boyfriend is currently on Lupron and hates it. He is finishing up chemo in a month and was thinking about going off Lupron at the same time. My question is what is considered intermittent Lupron treatments? How long and how much. Thank you very much and best of luck to you. His PSA is 45 and only has two more chemo treatments left. All cases are a bit different but in my case the intermittent will be 6 months on and then of my PSA has dropped back to undetectable then I will stop the injections until my PSA starts to climb (if it does) then I will start the injections again until a time when the PSA climbs again. The studies and my doc have said that way the body will not adjust to the lupron as quickly allowing it to work longer as well as lessor side effects than to have the injections for a long period of time.
Posts.Title: Thinking about quitting HT. Has anyone else?

Posts.Content: I stopped my treatments after 12 months of Lupron due to side effects. My PSA jumped back up from .01 to 8.6 in 9 months. After many tests and a lot of debating my Urologist and my Oncologist agreed that the best course of action is intermittent Lupron treatments. I just had my first injection and we are checking the PSA at 6 months, if it back down then I will stay off the Lupron, if not then I will stay on it until it does go down. They said that research has now shown that intermittent treatments cause less side effects and extends the time the meds work. So you may want to explore the intermittent treatments. My Oncologist is from Johns Hopkins so I trust him. I hate to go back on the meds but feel this is the best thing for me at this point.
Posts.Title: Thinking about quitting HT. Has anyone else?

Posts.Content: Also do not assume your time is limited, the doctors are not god and can't predict the time you have left. Also new meds and treatments are evolving every day. My Urologist told me I could expect 2 to 5 years and the Oncologist said that was ridiculous, he saw no reason that I shouldn't have a lot of years left.

Posts.Title: Thinking about quitting HT. Has anyone else?

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by white08gt got my Eligard shot in the stomach the 12th of June and have every side effect mentioned. some are worse than others. is this the same as Lupron, just another maker? this is not helping with manhood returning. When you got the shot did you have extreme pain in your stomach, chest and shoulder area for an hour or so? I had always had the Lupron shot in my thigh before but the VA hospital didn't use it so the doctor put me on the Eligard. I had extreme pain that started about 10 minutes after the shot so bad I could hardly walk to the car. It started to go away after about an hour or so. I had stopped the injections because my doctor had decided to put me on intermittent treatments to see how the cancer responded. However we found out quickly that I am not a candidate for intermittent treatments. My PSA was climbing fast and the cancer had started to spread in my hip and neck. He said my cancer was very aggressive. I have all the side effects that are know and then some I think. Two years ago I worked hard every day, had a great sex life and energy to spare. Now it is like I have aged 20 years, I spend almost all of my days sitting in the recliner watching TV and sleeping, have zero sex drive or ability and I don't remember what it feels like to have energy. Seems I have the choice of an earlier death or living the life of the walking dead. I just hope and pray every day that they come out with a new medicine that has less side effects.
Posts.Title: WHY is there no sticky on HT

Posts.Content: Megestrol (Megace) works great for me. Doc put me on 1/2 Tablet twice a day at forst and then raeduced to 1/2 tablet once a day and it pretty well eliminated the hot flashes for me and I was having whopers before.
Posts.Title: Hope for men suffering Hot Flashes after starting HT

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed with PC in 2011 with a 4+3 and a 3+4 biopsy result. After talking to my doctor at the military hospital and the civilian Oncologist I opted for the external beam radiation treatments and received them in Dec of 2011. I was then put on Lupron injections for the hormone treatments, this continued until Dec of 2012. I was experiencing pretty severe side effects so my doctor stopped the treatments. My PSA was at 24 prior to the radiation treatments and dropped to .10 within 1 year. I had a PSA check in March 2013 and it was at .13, when the test was repeated in 08 Oct it had risen to 5.34. Upon returning to Florida and my original Uroligist had left the military and my new Uroligist repeated the test to rule out machine error and in 3 weeks it had risen to 7.39. He ordered a new bone scan and CT scan and biopsy but immediately started talking about performing surgery to remove the prostate. I have completed the bone scan and doing the CT scan tomorrow with a biopsy on the 22nd. My research so far has pretty well convinced me that I do not want the surgery due to the possible complications and quality of life issues afterward. My original Uroligist told me that surgery after the external beam radiation would be pretty well impossible to do and not advised. I am only 59 and still live a very active life with a lot of travel, motorcycle riding and we RV full time. I am not ready to be tied down at home with problems from the surgery like an old man. I know a lot depends on the outcome of the tests as far as what can be done but I am not sure who to believe or what I want to allow them to do. I am leaning towards intermittent hormonei therapy to maybe lessen the side effects. The doctor just seems to ready to cut on me and that does not put me at ease. I am hoping someone here has been in my situation and can give me their opinion?
Posts.Title: Need opinions on next step

Posts.Content: I have completed the bone scan and CT scan so just waiting for the doctor to return from leave to call and give me the results. This will determine if we do another biopsy or not. I am leaning towards just going back on the lupron and see what happens to the psa levels. I have also requested to be referred to another doctor for a second opinion on the surgery if that is what he recommends as the next step. Going to try to get them to send me to Walter Reed military cancer center in MD if I can swing it. Before I risk surgery I need all the info I can get. My life traveling is just too active to risk the side effects of surgery if it is not needed for sure.

Posts.Title: Need opinions on next step

Posts.Content: My wife gets on to me all the time and asks, how can you joke about dying, all I can tell her is, if I don't joke and laugh about it I will cry instead and I would much more want to laugh. I know the reality that I will never grow old more than likely, but there is always the chance a cure will come along, however I can't just roll over and die now. I am going to travel, visit family and friends and live my life while I can. After all there are advantages to dying young, we don't worry about extended warrantees or saving for the future or how long an item will last, no need for new cars or new clothes, the things we have will outlast us. I am sure none of us want to die, and I know I don't, but I will not allow myself to sit around and worry about it either. If your husband is cancer free and remains that way I am very happy for him and you and no one here will fault you for being happy too. Now you may get chewed out for feeling sorry that he is ok and we are not. Besides he has to look forward to the curse of old age, and there is no cure for that! (:
Posts.Title: Reality check...
